channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: Trump Likely To Inform Countries Of US Tariffs Today

media:content.media:description: Trump said he plans to start sending letters informing trading partners of their tariffs.

item.description: President Donald Trump said he plans to start sending letters informing trading partners of their tariff rates as soon as Friday, as negotiations to avoid higher US levies enter the final stretch.
item.content:encoded: President Donald Trump said he plans to start sending letters informing trading partners of their tariff rates as soon as Friday, as negotiations to avoid higher US levies enter the final stretch.

item.title: North Korea Slams Quad For Calling It To Denuclearise

media:content.media:description: North Korea also said the U.S. fabricated a "cyber threat" from North Korea.

item.description: North Korea slammed on Friday the Quad grouping of the United States, India, Japan and Australia for insisting North Korea denuclearise, according to its state media KCNA.
item.content:encoded: North Korea slammed on Friday the Quad grouping of the United States, India, Japan and Australia for insisting North Korea denuclearise, according to its state media KCNA.

item.title: Iran Announces Opening Of Its Airspace After War

media:content.media:description: Iran announced Thursday that it has reopened its airspace, including over Tehran.

item.description: Iran announced Thursday that it has reopened its airspace, including over Tehran, after closing it on June 13 due to the war with Israel, according to state media.
item.content:encoded: Iran announced Thursday that it has reopened its airspace, including over Tehran, after closing it on June 13 due to the war with Israel, according to state media.

item.title: PM Modi Arrives In Trinidad & Tobago, Gets Guard Of Honour

media:content.media:description: PM Modi arrived here on Thursday on the second leg of his five-nation tour,.

item.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived here on Thursday on the second leg of his five-nation tour, during which he will hold talks with the top leadership of Trinidad and Tobago to further strengthen the bilateral relationship.
item.content:encoded: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived here on Thursday on the second leg of his five-nation tour, during which he will hold talks with the top leadership of Trinidad and Tobago to further strengthen the bilateral relationship.

item.title: Trump Says "Didn't Make Any Progress" On Ukraine During Putin Call

media:content.media:description: Trump said that he was not happy about the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine.

item.description: US President Donald Trump said he had made no progress with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin towards a ceasefire in Ukraine after the two leaders spoke by phone on Thursday.
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump said he had made no progress with Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin towards a ceasefire in Ukraine after the two leaders spoke by phone on Thursday.

item.title: PM Modi 5-Nation Tour Live Updates: PM Arrives In Trinidad & Tobago After Concluding Ghana Visit

media:content.media:description: PM Modi 5-Nation Tour Live Updates: PM Modi is in Ghana today

item.description: PM Modi 5-Nation Tour Live Updates: The Prime Minister will visit Argentina, Ghana, Namibia, Brazil, and Trinidad and Tobago. Ghana will be the first stop in the Prime Minister's visit, where he will meet President John Dramani Mahama
item.content:encoded: PM Modi 5-Nation Tour Live Updates: The Prime Minister will visit Argentina, Ghana, Namibia, Brazil, and Trinidad and Tobago. Ghana will be the first stop in the Prime Minister's visit, where he will meet President John Dramani Mahama

item.title: Russia Becomes 1st Country To Recognise Taliban Government Of Afghanistan
item.description: Russia said on Thursday it had accepted the credentials of a new ambassador of Afghanistan, making it the first nation to recognise the Taliban government of the country.
item.content:encoded: Russia said on Thursday it had accepted the credentials of a new ambassador of Afghanistan, making it the first nation to recognise the Taliban government of the country.

item.title: How Will Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill' Impact US Climate Policy?

media:content.media:description: Trump received an estimated $445 million from Big Oil during his campaign.

item.description: With the passage of his party's "One Big Beautiful Bill," Republican President Donald Trump has largely delivered on his promise of curtailing Joe Biden's landmark climate law.
item.content:encoded: With the passage of his party's "One Big Beautiful Bill," Republican President Donald Trump has largely delivered on his promise of curtailing Joe Biden's landmark climate law.

item.title: Trump To Sign Flagship Bill On US Independence Day Today: White House
item.description: US President Donald Trump will sign his "big beautiful" tax and spending bill in a ceremony on Independence Day on Friday after it passed Congress, the White House said.
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump will sign his "big beautiful" tax and spending bill in a ceremony on Independence Day on Friday after it passed Congress, the White House said.

item.title: Trump Scores Big Victory As 'One Big Beautiful Bill' Clears Congress
item.description: US President Donald Trump secured a major political victory when Congress narrowly passed his flagship tax and spending bill, cementing his radical second-term agenda and boosting funds for his anti-immigration drive.
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump secured a major political victory when Congress narrowly passed his flagship tax and spending bill, cementing his radical second-term agenda and boosting funds for his anti-immigration drive.

item.title: Which US President Refused To Celebrate The Fourth Of July
item.description: Every president since George Washington has celebrated the Fourth of July, but one refused to do so.
item.content:encoded: Every president since George Washington has celebrated the Fourth of July, but one refused to do so.

item.title: Will The EU Delay Enforcing Its AI Act?

media:content.media:description: The European Commission hasn't yet commented on postponing the enforcement of the new rules

item.description: With less than a month to go before parts of the European Union's AI Act come into force, companies are calling for a pause in the provisions and getting support from some politicians. European companies have urged the AI act to be delayed by years.
item.content:encoded: With less than a month to go before parts of the European Union's AI Act come into force, companies are calling for a pause in the provisions and getting support from some politicians. European companies have urged the AI act to be delayed by years.

item.title: 'Reservoir Dogs' And 'Kill Bill' Star Michael Madsen Dies At 66
item.description: Michael Madsen, whose menacing characters in "Reservoir Dogs" and "Kill Bill" made him a standout in Quentin Tarantino's films, has died.
item.content:encoded: Michael Madsen, whose menacing characters in "Reservoir Dogs" and "Kill Bill" made him a standout in Quentin Tarantino's films, has died.

item.title: Bomb Threats Disrupt Flights at Six Major Canadian Airports

media:content.media:description: Major Canadian airports were forced to delay some flights after receiving bomb threats

item.description: Major Canadian airports were forced to delay some flights Thursday after receiving bomb threats, according to the country's air traffic authority.
item.content:encoded: Major Canadian airports were forced to delay some flights Thursday after receiving bomb threats, according to the country's air traffic authority.

item.title: UN Climate Bank Bets On Underfunded Clean Tech In India

media:content.media:description: India has installed around 179 gigawatts of renewable capacity, from just 4 gigawatts a decade ago

item.description: The Asian Development Bank and the UN Green Climate Fund are set to launch a financial facility to bolster emerging clean technologies in India.
item.content:encoded: The Asian Development Bank and the UN Green Climate Fund are set to launch a financial facility to bolster emerging clean technologies in India.

item.title: NASA Detects 'Interstellar Visitor' Hurtling Through Solar System
item.description: The comet-like body, designated 3I/ATLAS, is hurtling towards the Sun at a speed of over 60 kilometres per second
item.content:encoded: The comet-like body, designated 3I/ATLAS, is hurtling towards the Sun at a speed of over 60 kilometres per second

item.title: Peru Fines Lima Clinic $190,000 For Leak Of Shakira's Medical Records

media:content.media:description: Shakira fell ill upon her arrival in Lima and went to the Delgado Clinic.

item.description: A Peruvian regulator hit private health-care provider Auna SA with a stiff fine for the unauthorised disclosure of medical records belonging to popular singer Shakira.
item.content:encoded: A Peruvian regulator hit private health-care provider Auna SA with a stiff fine for the unauthorised disclosure of medical records belonging to popular singer Shakira.

item.title: Trump's CIA Backs 2016 Assessment That Putin Wanted Him to Win

media:content.media:description: A fresh CIA review agreed with earlier conclusions that Russia interfered in the 2016 election

item.description: A fresh CIA review agreed with earlier conclusions that Russia interfered in the 2016 election to help President Donald Trump beat Hillary Clinton - while criticizing what it called procedural flaws.
item.content:encoded: A fresh CIA review agreed with earlier conclusions that Russia interfered in the 2016 election to help President Donald Trump beat Hillary Clinton - while criticizing what it called procedural flaws.

item.title: Canned-Food Producer Del Monte Foods Files for Bankruptcy

media:content.media:description: Canned fruit company Del Monte Foods filed for bankruptcy

item.description: Canned fruit company Del Monte Foods filed for bankruptcy, less than a year after executing a controversial debt restructuring.
item.content:encoded: Canned fruit company Del Monte Foods filed for bankruptcy, less than a year after executing a controversial debt restructuring.

item.title: Putin Stands Firm On Ukraine, Tells Trump Iran Solution Should Be Diplomatic
item.description: Vladimir Putin told Donald Trump on a call that Moscow will not "give up" on its aims in Ukraine, while pledging it will also keep up a negotiating process on the conflict.
item.content:encoded: Vladimir Putin told Donald Trump on a call that Moscow will not "give up" on its aims in Ukraine, while pledging it will also keep up a negotiating process on the conflict.
